description: A CSF file is used to define the coordinate system of input data with no specified coordinate system. It is created when the input data is exported to an output data format, such as the MicroStation V7 format. When it is exported, the CSF file is generated in the same location as the output file(s).
NOTE: To create or edit a CSF file, use the "Define Coordinate System File" utility included with the GeoMedia software.

common_filenames.description: ExportDGN.csf - The CSF file bear this name if multiple output files are produced. If only one output file is produced, the CSF file will be named with the same name as the output file.
